WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN FAMILIES EAT?
A QUESTIONNAIRE

(Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.)

Name: Mary E. Little (Mrs. George C. Little)
Address: 139 Little Ave., Saskatoon, Sask.
Birthplace: Hamilton, Ont.

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS
What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1924
Where did you set up housekeeping? Regina, Saskatchewan
Where had you been living before that? Ontario
For how many people did you prepare meals? 6
How far was it to your nearest store? 35 mi.
How often could a visit be made to the store? every 2 or 3 months
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years? salt, rice, sugar, tapioca, brown and white sugar, molasses, syrup, soda, baking powder, beans, split peas, wheat, currants, evaporated apples, peaches, prunes, figs, black pepper, mustard, cinnamon, cloves, ginger.

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS
What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Fromatta
In what quantities did you buy it? Hundredweights
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? about $3.50 cwt.
How much did you use graham flour? 1 lb.
Whole wheat flour? 1 lb.
Was flour milled locally? Yes
How far away? 35 mi.
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? Wheat coffee
What other grain products did you use? Wheat, coffee
Cornmeal? Yes
Whole wheat? No
Farina? Yes
Other? Wheat
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? Later when some were grown
How did you grind it? Hard grinder and later coffee mill

Stoughton, 1924

4. DAIRY PRODUCTS

How did you get a supply of fresh milk in the early days?

Butter? churned and used

Eggs? brown and brown

What was the price of butter? 10¢ per lb.

Did you pick eggs for winter? Yes

Did you make butter? Yes

Did you make cheese? No

What kind of cheese?

5. MEAT AND FISH

What was your meat supply in the early years? Our own pigs and cattle

How did you get fresh meat? Only in winter when we could hunt, frozen pork or beef

How often did you get fresh meat? When we killed our own hogs, chicken or shot the rabbit

How did you preserve meat? Salting (dry or brine), smoking with prairie wool

Was there a "beef ring" in your neighborhood? No

If so what year was it organized?

Did you use game? Yes

What kinds? rabbit, prairie chickens, field ducks

For how long? fall in fall, rabbits during winter

What part did fish play in the family diet? No, very limited, too hard to get

Was the fish fresh, cured, or canned? Fresh, frozen in winter, canned in summer

Kinds? jacks

Did you make your own vinegar? Clear water, acetic acid and a little sugar
